title: 113_s2005
content: The Act may be cited as the "CLEAR Cost Information Act of 2013" and requires reporting of certain hospital payment data. The Social Security Act is being amended to make changes in subsection (a)(1), including adjustments to subparagraphs (V) and (W) as outlined in Public Law 111-148. The Social Security Act is being amended to include reporting requirements for subsection (d) hospitals to submit payment data to the Secretary. The Social Security Act is being amended to include reporting requirements for subsection (d) hospitals to submit payment data to the Secretary for the 50 most common diagnosis-related groups and ambulatory payment classification groups. The Social Security Act is being amended to include reporting requirements for subsection (d) hospitals to submit payment data transparently for public access on a searchable website. The Social Security Act is amended to require subsection (d) hospitals to report payment data by zip code on their website for consumer understanding. The amendments apply to contracts entered into or renewed after the enactment of this Act. The Medicare Payment Advisory Commission's annual reports to Congress must now include information on the percentage of charity care provided by hospitals. Additionally, a report on charity care trends from certain hospitals will be made publicly available. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to require the Secretary of the Treasury to post data on a publicly accessible website for meaningful comparisons by zip code. Additionally, hospitals must provide a link to this data on their home webpage as per Medicare requirements. Medicare now requires hospitals to include a link on their website to data posted for comparison by zip code. Medicare mandates hospitals to include a link on their website to data for comparison by zip code, effective for new contracts after the enactment of the Act.
